verses.verse: Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> the things whereof <S%G3739><s%> ye wrote <S%G1125><s%> unto me <S%G3427><s%>: It is good <S%G2570><s%> for a man <S%G444><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> to touch <S%G680><s%> a woman <S%G1135><s%>.

Nevertheless <S%G1223><s%> <S%G1161><s%>, to avoid fornication <S%G4202><s%>, let <S%G2192><s%> every man <S%G1538><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> his own <S%G1438><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> let <S%G2192><s%> every woman <S%G1538><s%> have <S%G2192><s%> her own <S%G2398><s%> husband <S%G435><s%>.

Let <S%G591><s%> the husband <S%G435><s%> render <S%G591><s%> unto the wife <S%G1135><s%> due <S%G3784><s%> benevolence <S%G2133><s%>: and <S%G1161><s%> likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%> unto the husband <S%G435><s%>.

The wife <S%G1135><s%> hath <S%G1850><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> power <S%G1850><s%> of her own <S%G2398><s%> body <S%G4983><s%>, but <S%G235><s%> the husband <S%G435><s%>: and <S%G1161><s%> likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> the husband <S%G435><s%> hath <S%G1850><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> power <S%G1850><s%> of his own <S%G2398><s%> body <S%G4983><s%>, but <S%G235><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%>.

Defraud ye <S%G650><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> one the other <S%G240><s%>, except <S%G1509><s%> <S%G302><s%> it be <S%G5100><s%> with <S%G1537><s%> consent <S%G4859><s%> for <S%G4314><s%> a time <S%G2540><s%>, that <S%G2443><s%> ye may give yourselves <S%G4980><s%> to fasting <S%G3521><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> prayer <S%G4335><s%>; and <S%G2532><s%> come <S%G4905><s%> together <S%G1909><s%> <S%G846><s%> again <S%G3825><s%>, that <S%G3363><s%> Satan <S%G4567><s%> tempt <S%G3985><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> not <S%G3363><s%> for <S%G1223><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> incontinency <S%G192><s%>.
But <S%G1161><s%> I speak <S%G3004><s%> this <S%G5124><s%> by <S%G2596><s%> permission <S%G4774><s%>, and not <S%G3756><s%> of <S%G2596><s%> commandment <S%G2003><s%>.

For <S%G1063><s%> I would <S%G2309><s%> that all <S%G3956><s%> men <S%G444><s%> were <S%G1511><s%> even <S%G2532><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> I myself <S%G1683><s%>. But <S%G235><s%> every man <S%G1538><s%> hath <S%G2192><s%> his proper <S%G2398><s%> gift <S%G5486><s%> of <S%G1537><s%> God <S%G2316><s%>, one <S%G3739><s%> <S%G3303><s%> after this manner <S%G3779><s%>, and <S%G1161><s%> another <S%G3739><s%> after that <S%G3779><s%>.

I say <S%G3004><s%> therefore <S%G1161><s%> to the unmarried <S%G22><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> widows <S%G5503><s%>, It is <S%G2076><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> for them <S%G846><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> they abide <S%G3306><s%> even <S%G2504><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> I <S%G2504><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> they <S%G1467><s%> cannot <S%G3756><s%> contain <S%G1467><s%>, let them marry <S%G1060><s%>: for <S%G1063><s%> it is <S%G2076><s%> better <S%G2909><s%> to marry <S%G1060><s%> than <S%G2228><s%> to burn <S%G4448><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> unto the married <S%G1060><s%> I command <S%G3853><s%>, yet not <S%G3756><s%> I <S%G1473><s%>, but <S%G235><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%>, Let <S%G5563><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%> depart <S%G5563><s%> from <S%G575><s%> her husband <S%G435><s%>:

But <S%G1161><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> she depart <S%G5563><s%>, let her remain <S%G3306><s%> unmarried <S%G22><s%>, or <S%G2228><s%> be reconciled <S%G2644><s%> to her husband <S%G435><s%>: and <S%G2532><s%> let <S%G863><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> the husband <S%G435><s%> put away <S%G863><s%> his wife <S%G1135><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> to the rest <S%G3062><s%> speak <S%G3004><s%> I <S%G1473><s%>, not <S%G3756><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%>: If any <S%G1536><s%> brother <S%G80><s%> hath <S%G2192><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%> that believeth not <S%G571><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> she <S%G846><s%> be pleased <S%G4909><s%> to dwell <S%G3611><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> him <S%G846><s%>, let him <S%G863><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> put <S%G863><s%> her <S%G846><s%> away <S%G863><s%>.

And <S%G2532><s%> the woman <S%G1135><s%> which <S%G3748><s%> hath <S%G2192><s%> an husband <S%G435><s%> that believeth not <S%G571><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> if he <S%G846><s%> be pleased <S%G4909><s%> to dwell <S%G3611><s%> with <S%G3326><s%> her <S%G846><s%>, let her <S%G863><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> leave <S%G863><s%> him <S%G846><s%>.

For <S%G1063><s%> the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> is sanctified <S%G37><s%> by <S%G1722><s%> the wife <S%G1135><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> wife <S%G1135><s%> is sanctified <S%G37><s%> by <S%G1722><s%> the husband <S%G435><s%>: else <S%G686><s%> <S%G1893><s%> were <S%G2076><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> children <S%G5043><s%> unclean <S%G169><s%>; but <S%G1161><s%> now <S%G3568><s%> are they <S%G2076><s%> holy <S%G40><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1487><s%> the unbelieving <S%G571><s%> depart <S%G5563><s%>, let him depart <S%G5563><s%>. A brother <S%G80><s%> or <S%G2228><s%> a sister <S%G79><s%> is <S%G1402><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> under bondage <S%G1402><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> cases: but <S%G1161><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> hath called <S%G2564><s%> us <S%G2248><s%> to <S%G1722><s%> peace <S%G1515><s%>.

For <S%G1063><s%> what <S%G5101><s%> knowest thou <S%G1492><s%>, O wife <S%G1135><s%>, whether <S%G1487><s%> thou shalt save <S%G4982><s%> thy husband <S%G435><s%>? or <S%G2228><s%> how <S%G5101><s%> knowest thou <S%G1492><s%>, O man <S%G435><s%>, whether <S%G1487><s%> thou shalt save <S%G4982><s%> thy wife <S%G1135><s%>?

But <S%G1508><s%> as <S%G5613><s%> God <S%G2316><s%> hath distributed <S%G3307><s%> to every man <S%G1538><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> hath called <S%G2564><s%> every one <S%G1538><s%>, so <S%G3779><s%> let him walk <S%G4043><s%>. And <S%G2532><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> ordain I <S%G1299><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> all <S%G3956><s%> churches <S%G1577><s%>.

Is <S%G2564><s%> any man <S%G5100><s%> called <S%G2564><s%> being circumcised <S%G4059><s%>? let him <S%G1986><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> become uncircumcised <S%G1986><s%>. Is <S%G2564><s%> any <S%G5100><s%> called <S%G2564><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> uncircumcision <S%G203><s%>? let him <S%G4059><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> be circumcised <S%G4059><s%>.

Circumcision <S%G4061><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> uncircumcision <S%G203><s%> is <S%G2076><s%> nothing <S%G3762><s%>, but <S%G235><s%> the keeping <S%G5084><s%> of the commandments <S%G1785><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%>.
Let <S%G3306><s%> every man <S%G1538><s%> abide <S%G3306><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the same <S%G5026><s%> calling <S%G2821><s%> wherein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3739><s%> he was called <S%G2564><s%>.

Art thou called <S%G2564><s%> being a servant <S%G1401><s%>? care <S%G3199><s%> <S%G4671><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> for it <S%G3199><s%>: but <S%G235><s%> if <S%G1499><s%> thou mayest <S%G1410><s%> be made <S%G1096><s%> free <S%G1658><s%>, use <S%G5530><s%> it rather <S%G3123><s%>.

For <S%G1063><s%> he that is called <S%G2564><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%>, being a servant <S%G1401><s%>, is <S%G2076><s%> the Lord's <S%G2962><s%> freeman <S%G558><s%>: likewise <S%G3668><s%> also <S%G2532><s%> he that is called <S%G2564><s%>, being free <S%G1658><s%>, is <S%G2076><s%> Christ's <S%G5547><s%> servant <S%G1401><s%>.
Ye are bought <S%G59><s%> with a price <S%G5092><s%>; be <S%G1096><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> ye <S%G1096><s%> the servants <S%G1401><s%> of men <S%G444><s%>.

Brethren <S%G80><s%>, let <S%G3306><s%> every man <S%G1538><s%>, wherein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G3739><s%> he is called <S%G2564><s%>, therein <S%G1722><s%> <S%G5129><s%> abide <S%G3306><s%> with <S%G3844><s%> God <S%G2316><s%>.

Now <S%G1161><s%> concerning <S%G4012><s%> virgins <S%G3933><s%> I have <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3756><s%> commandment <S%G2003><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%>: yet <S%G1161><s%> I give <S%G1325><s%> my judgment <S%G1106><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> one that hath obtained mercy <S%G1653><s%> of <S%G5259><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> to be <S%G1511><s%> faithful <S%G4103><s%>.

I suppose <S%G3543><s%> therefore <S%G3767><s%> that this <S%G5124><s%> is <S%G5225><s%> good <S%G2570><s%> for <S%G1223><s%> the present <S%G1764><s%> distress <S%G318><s%>, I say, that <S%G3754><s%> it is good <S%G2570><s%> for a man <S%G444><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> to be <S%G1511><s%>.

Art thou bound <S%G1210><s%> unto a wife <S%G1135><s%>? seek <S%G2212><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> to be loosed <S%G3080><s%>. Art thou loosed <S%G3089><s%> from <S%G575><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%>? seek <S%G2212><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> thou marry <S%G1060><s%>, thou hast <S%G264><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> sinned <S%G264><s%>; and <S%G2532><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> a virgin <S%G3933><s%> marry <S%G1060><s%>, she hath <S%G264><s%> not <S%G3756><s%> sinned <S%G264><s%>. Nevertheless <S%G1161><s%> such <S%G5108><s%> shall have <S%G2192><s%> trouble <S%G2347><s%> in the flesh <S%G4561><s%>: but <S%G1161><s%> I <S%G1473><s%> spare <S%G5339><s%> you <S%G5216><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> this <S%G5124><s%> I say <S%G5346><s%>, brethren <S%G80><s%>, the time <S%G2540><s%> is short <S%G4958><s%>: it remaineth <S%G2076><s%> <S%G3063><s%>, that <S%G2443><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> they that have <S%G2192><s%> wives <S%G1135><s%> be <S%G5600><s%> as though <S%G5613><s%> they had <S%G2192><s%> none <S%G3361><s%>;

And <S%G2532><s%> they that weep <S%G2799><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> though they wept <S%G2799><s%> not <S%G3361><s%>; and <S%G2532><s%> they that rejoice <S%G5463><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> though they rejoiced <S%G5463><s%> not <S%G3361><s%>; and <S%G2532><s%> they that buy <S%G59><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> though they possessed <S%G2722><s%> not <S%G3361><s%>;

And <S%G2532><s%> they that use <S%G5530><s%> this <S%G5127><s%> world <S%G2889><s%>, as <S%G5613><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> abusing <S%G2710><s%> it: for <S%G1063><s%> the fashion <S%G4976><s%> of this <S%G5129><s%> world <S%G2889><s%> passeth away <S%G3855><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> I would have <S%G1511><s%> <S%G2309><s%> you <S%G5209><s%> without carefulness <S%G275><s%>. He that is unmarried <S%G22><s%> careth <S%G3309><s%> for the things that belong to <S%G3588><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%>, how <S%G4459><s%> he may please <S%G700><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%>:

But <S%G1161><s%> he that is married <S%G1060><s%> careth <S%G3309><s%> for the things that are <S%G3588><s%> of the world <S%G2889><s%>, how <S%G4459><s%> he may please <S%G700><s%> his wife <S%G1135><s%>.

There is difference also between <S%G3307><s%> a wife <S%G1135><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> a virgin <S%G3933><s%>. The unmarried woman <S%G22><s%> careth for <S%G3309><s%> the things <S%G3588><s%> of the Lord <S%G2962><s%>, that <S%G2443><s%> she may be <S%G5600><s%> holy <S%G40><s%> both <S%G2532><s%> in body <S%G4983><s%> and <S%G2532><s%> in spirit <S%G4151><s%>: but <S%G1161><s%> she that is married <S%G1060><s%> careth <S%G3309><s%> for the things <S%G3588><s%> of the world <S%G2889><s%>, how <S%G4459><s%> she may please <S%G700><s%> her husband <S%G435><s%>.

And <S%G1161><s%> this <S%G5124><s%> I speak <S%G3004><s%> for <S%G4314><s%> your <S%G5216><s%> own <S%G846><s%> profit <S%G4851><s%>; not <S%G3756><s%> that <S%G2443><s%> I may cast <S%G1911><s%> a snare <S%G1029><s%> upon you <S%G5213><s%>, but <S%G235><s%> for that which <S%G4314><s%> is comely <S%G2158><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> that ye may attend upon <S%G2145><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%> without distraction <S%G563><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> if any man <S%G1536><s%> think <S%G3543><s%> that he behaveth himself uncomely <S%G807><s%> toward <S%G1909><s%> his <S%G846><s%> virgin <S%G3933><s%>, if <S%G1437><s%> she pass the flower of her age <S%G5230><s%> <S%G5600><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> need <S%G3784><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> require <S%G1096><s%>, let him do <S%G4160><s%> what <S%G3739><s%> he will <S%G2309><s%>, he sinneth <S%G264><s%> not <S%G3756><s%>: let them marry <S%G1060><s%>.

Nevertheless <S%G1161><s%> he <S%G3739><s%> that standeth <S%G2476><s%> stedfast <S%G1476><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> his heart <S%G2588><s%>, having <S%G2192><s%> no <S%G3361><s%> necessity <S%G318><s%>, but <S%G1161><s%> hath <S%G2192><s%> power <S%G1849><s%> over <S%G4012><s%> his own <S%G2398><s%> will <S%G2307><s%>, and <S%G2532><s%> hath <S%G2919><s%> so <S%G5124><s%> decreed <S%G2919><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> his <S%G846><s%> heart <S%G2588><s%> that he will keep <S%G5083><s%> his <S%G1438><s%> virgin <S%G3933><s%>, doeth <S%G4160><s%> well <S%G2573><s%>.

So <S%G5620><s%> then <S%G2532><s%> he that giveth her in marriage <S%G1547><s%> doeth <S%G4160><s%> well <S%G2573><s%>; but <S%G1161><s%> he that giveth her <S%G1547><s%> not <S%G3361><s%> in marriage <S%G1547><s%> doeth <S%G4160><s%> better <S%G2908><s%>.

The wife <S%G1135><s%> is bound <S%G1210><s%> by the law <S%G3551><s%> <S%G1909><s%> as long <S%G5550><s%> as <S%G3745><s%> her <S%G846><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> liveth <S%G2198><s%>; but <S%G1161><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> her <S%G846><s%> husband <S%G435><s%> be dead <S%G2837><s%>, she is <S%G2076><s%> at liberty <S%G1658><s%> to be married <S%G1060><s%> to whom <S%G3739><s%> she will <S%G2309><s%>; only <S%G3440><s%> in <S%G1722><s%> the Lord <S%G2962><s%>.

But <S%G1161><s%> she is <S%G2076><s%> happier <S%G3107><s%> if <S%G1437><s%> she <S%G3306><s%> so <S%G3779><s%> abide <S%G3306><s%>, after <S%G2596><s%> my <S%G1699><s%> judgment <S%G1106><s%>: and <S%G1161><s%> I think <S%G1380><s%> also <S%G2504><s%> that I have <S%G2192><s%> the Spirit <S%G4151><s%> of God <S%G2316><s%>.
